body.p: The Board considered two main ways to overcome the issue noted in paragraph BC176(b). These were:

li.p: to designate the hedged item as the overall net position that results from a portfolio containing assets and liabilities. For example, if a repricing time period contains CU100 of fixed rate assets and CU90 of fixed rate liabilities, the net position of CU10 would be designated as the hedged item.
to designate the hedged item as a portion of the assets (ie assets of CU10 in the above example), but not to require individual assets to be designated.
